reviewText: The sound was awful, we couldn't understand the words. Total waste of money.
I love classic movies . It is reasonable to expect some minor flaws in acting , the script etc...  However this movie is boring start to finish I am sorry to say .

Dick Merrill really is terrible in it, he delivers his lines as though he were reading them off of badly written cue cards. His co-pilot, Jack Lambie (my uncle) is suprisingly natural except for one scene, not that he had any demanding scenes. Hey, they were pilots, not actors.

The script is bad, but the acting is ... adequate to good. Now I think about it, the acting was pretty good for 1937.

The star of ATLANTIC FLIGHT, Dick Merrill was an Eastern Airlines pilot who achieved a few transoceanic "firsts" in the 1930s. This role was Merrill's lone screen appearance. As an actor.... he was a great aviator! SYNOPSIS: Merrill (as transport pilot Dick Bennett) is somewhat peripheral to a love feud between Bill Edwards (Heyburn), designer of the plane Dick will fly in a cup race, and pretty blonde heiress Gale Strong (P. Stone). At an airport coffee shop, Gale overhears Bill make insulting remarks about her. That night at a party he tells her she's a spendthrift, not interested in aviation and afraid to fly. This upsets Gale and she leaves. Bill later displays jealousy when he finds mechanic 'Pokey' (M. Stone) teaching Gale how to parachute jump. Gale informs Bill that she plans to marry Baron Heygard (Lebedeff) if he wins the air event. What follows is sabotage, a crash and a desperate race to procure a life-saving serum. ALPHA VIDEO is a provider of vintage programming that's often unavailable elsewhere. Their prices are fair, but so is transfer quality of some of their offerings. None have undergone restoration, yet this product's rareness and an honest price make it a worthwhile purchase. Related ALPHA product: BUSH PILOT (1947) is an adventure tale set in Canada's rugged northern wilderness. Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 viewer poll rating found at a film resource website. (6.2) Atlantic Flight (1937) - Dick Merrill/Jack Lambie/Paula Stone/Weldon Heyburn/Milburn Stone/Ivan Lebedeff (uncredited: I. Stanford Jolley/George Cleveland)
